title: Localized Chern class
summary: In algebraic geometry, a localized Chern class is a variant of a Chern class, that is defined for a chain complex of vector bundles as opposed to a single vector bundle. It was originally introduced in Fulton's intersection theory,[1] as an algebraic counterpart of the similar construction in algebraic topology.
